OrgName: AAR CORP. and its affiliates located in the U.S.
activities: AAR CORP. and its affiliates located in the U.S. receive personal information in various forms regarding employees of affiliates located in Europe.   Such information is used for: employee communications and notices; providing business contact information via intranet directories, business cards, and other promotional media to present and potential customers, suppliers, other business associates; global headcount reports and demographics; career development, performance feedback, and progression; staffing and succession planning; compensation (including bonus) approvals; designing, evaluating, and administering benefits, pension, and insurance programs; administration of employee stock plans; wire transferring funds to employee bank accounts that employees register for electronic payments; designing, evaluating and implementing education and training programs; access controls and security for facilities, computer network, and software applications; business planning, including prosecution of mergers, acquisitions, and divestitures; import and export controls; monitoring and enforcing compliance with company policies and procedures to the extent permitted by applicable law; internal and external investigations, including business practices reviews, to the extent permitted by applicable law; legal and regulatory reporting and other requirements, to the extent permitted by applicable law; making back-up copies of files for business continuity and disaster recovery purposes; and tax withholding calculations and reporting.
eucountries: Belgium, Denmark, France, Germany, Netherlands, Norway, Sweden, United Kingdom
personaldata: Employee personal information in any format (e.g. online, offline, manually processed)
